org.vngx.jsch.config

Class SessionConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.vngx.jsch.config.JSchConfig
      • org.vngx.jsch.config.SessionConfig
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SSHConfigConstants

    public class SessionConfig
extends JSchConfig

    SessionConfig allows the user to specify configuration properties for an instance of Session. Different sessions running in the same JVM can each have their own independent configurations by creating different instances of SessionConfig.

    The user only needs to set properties they wish to override which already exist in the global parent configuration singleton instance JSchConfig. Any properties which are not overridden in this instance will be retrieved from the default parent global configuration.

    Author:
    Michael Laudati
    See Also:
    JSchConfig

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SessionConfig()
      Creates a new instance of SessionConfig which uses the global JSchConfig singleton instance as the parent.
      SessionConfig(Map<String,String> properties)
      Creates a new instance of SessionConfig with the specified properties to load.
      SessionConfig(SessionConfig parentConfig)
      Creates a new instance of SessionConfig which uses the specified parent configuration for retrieving properties not defined in this configuration instance.

    • Method Detail

      • getCiphersC2S

        public String getCiphersC2S()
        Returns the checked list of client to server ciphers. Each cipher in the list is checked to verify it's available; any unavailable ciphers are removed from the list.
        Returns:
        comma delimited, checked list of ciphers for client to server in order by preference

      • getCiphersS2C

        public String getCiphersS2C()
        Returns the checked list of server to client ciphers. Each cipher in the list is checked to verify it's available; any unavailable ciphers are removed from the list.
        Returns:
        comma delimited, checked list of ciphers for server to client in order by preference
